chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert M Schoenfuss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 cash bond applied.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must follow treatment recommendations set by his mental health provider.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must participate in Restorative Justice Programs.  Referral for Restorative Justice Programs to be made within 30 days.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert M Schoenfuss

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert M Schoenfuss in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State relates agreement. State moves to amend count 1 to 943.23(3m) a class A misd. Court grants amendment. 

Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. VIS filed. Defendant addresses the court. 

Court relates and orders: 
Imposed and Stayed: 
60 days jail on each count - consecutive - STAYED 
6 days credit - count 1. 

2 Years probation - IMPOSED
Court costs
Must follow treatment recommendations set by his mental health provider. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Participate in Restorative Justice Programs. Referral to be made for the Restorative Justice Program within 30 days.
4/29/15 Letter from Attorney Huff to Judge Babler regarding plea hearing

Defendant Robert M Schoenfuss in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert M Schoenfuss in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense requests rescheduling.
Bond to continue in its present form.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert M Schoenfuss in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Robert M Schoenfuss in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:55 Officer Carey Strenke called and sworn - Direct by State 9:01 Cross exam by Attorney Huff 9:02 Court finds probable cause and binds over - Information filed - Not guilty plea entered.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant declined court appointed attorney and will hire counsel.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert M Schoenfuss in court.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court swears defendant and defendant signs blue form.  Court finds partially indigent and will appoint court-appointed attorney and orders repayment of $75 per month starting 12/1/14.  Defendant decides to hire own attorney.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits so defendant can obtain an attorney.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must have no contact with Fred M. or Meyer Trucking.

Defendant Robert M Schoenfuss in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Defendant Robert M Schoenfuss in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Does not qualify for Public Defender.  Will hire own attorney.  Bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:45 am.
